text: advanced English lesson 4 topic yardsale
part 3 vocabulary it's finally time to
show you what it was like to organize
and participate in a community yard sale
as one of the organizers I volunteered
to make all the signs for the yard sale
a week or two before the yard sale I
posted signs just to get other
participants and then on the day of the
yard sale I posted these big orange
signs we call that poster board so I
made these signs by hand because yard
sale signs are always made by hand and
then I posted them along the busy road
that leads to my neighborhood
our yard sale began at 8 o'clock in the
morning so before 8 o'clock we all had
to set up our tables there were about 5
households that participated
exercise 1 listen to the short
interviews with people at the yardsale
try to understand the meaning of the
words in bold and answer the questions
here's an example please listen
how's business since I made a few bucks
business is good you heard the woman say
I made a few bucks did the woman sell
anything yet if so how much to answer
these questions you need to understand
Bucks bucks is an informal way to talk
about dollars so she made a few bucks
she made a few dollars did she sell
anything yes not a lot but a little how
much are your CDs I'm selling them for a
dollar each but if you buy ten I'll cut
you a deal
you heard the man say I'll cut you a
deal will the man lower his price for
the CDs
the answer is yes to cut someone a deal
is to give them a good price cutting
suggests lowering the price so the man
is selling his CDs for $1 apiece but if
you buy 10 he'll lower the price he'll
cut you a deal
how's business slow at first a little
busy in there what's about waiting for
customers
you heard the woman say it's mellowed
out how is business at the moment how
does it compare to business earlier in
the day
you need to understand the word mellow
would suggest being calm being relaxed
so if it's mellowed out it's now calm
earlier it was busy now it's calmer
there are fewer people I see you have
lots of price tags on your things do you
negotiate oh yeah everything's got to go
make me an offer you heard the man say
everything's negotiable how willing is
the man to sell his things the man is
very willing to sell his things he has
price tags on his items but he's willing
to discuss the prices and change them he
says that everything has got to go he
wants to get rid of everything so he's
willing to negotiate negotiate is the
verb negotiable is the adjective
are you doing any shopping not really
I'm doing window shopping you heard the
woman say I'm window shopping or I'm
doing window shopping is the woman going
to buy anything the answer is no if
someone is window shopping they're just
looking just browsing normally we say
this at a store with an actual window so
someone is looking through the window at
things but not actually planning on
going in and buying anything but it's
understood even in this situation at a
yard sale she's just looking well things
are winding down I didn't sell
everything but I sold a lot so I'm
pretty pleased you heard me say things
are winding down so what does that mean
was I speaking at the beginning the
middle or at the end of the yard sale
if things are winding down they're
coming to an end they're coming to a
close of finish so this was said at the
end of the yard sale or towards the end
did you sell all your CDs I sold a lot
of them the one guy I made a killing you
heard the man say I made a killing is
the man pleased with the sales he made
yes he is if you make a killing you make
a lot of money this man sold a lot of
his CDs to one person and from that sale
he made a lot of money so he's
definitely pleased how's business it's
all right there are a lot of people who
are coming so that speaks for itself you
heard the woman say that speaks for
itself what does the woman think about
the level of interest shown at the yard
sale
the woman says that there are lots of
people coming to the yard sale and that
speaks for itself if something speaks
for itself it needs no further
explanation so the very fact that lots
of people are coming to the yard sale
already demonstrates a point it already
illustrates that there is definite
interest do you believe that one man's
junk is another man's treasure yes I do
you heard me ask the woman if she agrees
with the saying one man's junk is
another man's treasure she said she does
agree what does the saying mean this
saying were proverb means that something
may have no value for one person but it
may have value for another the woman I
interviewed explained that she'd like to
sell everything but even if she can't
she'll donate the rest because she knows
that her objects although they have no
value for her anymore
could have value for someone else in our
next exercise let's see how well you can
recall the expressions from exercise one
exercise to complete each statement with
one of the expressions number one if you
have a good product good experience and
a good economy you can in sales
let me help by showing you a choice of
two expressions the answer make a
killing number two when you go to a
shopping mall you don't have to buy
anything you can simply enjoy here's a
hint you can choose from these two
expressions and the answer is window
shopping
three a tip for buyers try not to pay
full price always ask if the seller can
here's a choice of two and the answer
cut you a deal for holiday shopping in
the u.s. begins in November and doesn't
until the last week of December here's
your clue a choice of two and the answer
wind down
five the amount of money Americans spend
on Christmas gifts Christmas decorations
and Christmas parties it's the biggest
holiday of the year in the u.s.
here's your choice of two expressions
and the answer speaks for itself
exercise three listen and answer my
questions question one based on your own
experience and in your circle of friends
at what time do evening parties usually
wind down
question two do you ever do any window
shopping if so where
you
question three some kinds of music can
be described as mellow for example
mellow jazz what else besides music can
help a person mellow out
question four they say that actions
speak louder than words think about
something you did recently that truly
reflects your character what action of
yours speaks for itself
question 5 give an example from your own
life that illustrates the saying one
man's junk is another man's treasure
additional practice for this lesson is
available at English cafe comm my user
name is Jennifer ESL follow the direct
link listed in the video description
well that's the end of our lesson thanks
for watching and happy studies
